item.title: About
item.description: My professional background is in .NET software engineering (C#, MVC, MSSQL, etc), though this is within the context of an ecosystem of other technologies related to deployment, version control, distribution and testing. Aside from that, I do have some expertise with the Linux operating system (mostly variants of Debian and openSUSE), which I have been using since ~2005. After several years working for the public sector, where I provided technical support for secure communications networks, I decided to take this in a more academic direction, studying computer security at the University of South Wales, and managing to earn a Masters’ degree in 2014.

item.title: My Projects
item.description: Software Security Azure Static Site Generators Developed using Microsoft Azure services, the static site generators (SSGs) consist of the following: Azure Functions - These implement the logic, and are roughly analogous to the controller methods in a .NET MVC application. Azure Logic Apps: An event-driven Logic App is responsible for causing the Function App to execute and for processing the output. Generally it’s what merges the HTML page templates with the content to be displayed.

item.title: Useful Links
